title: Today’s Brexit darlings will be 2049’s Strictly nobodies
text:
All glory is fleeting, the saying goes, though perhaps not more so than power. A photograph taken this week of Narendra Modi, Tony Blair, Henry Kissinger and Condoleezza Rice at the JP Morgan International Council, hands clasped in apparent affection, showed just that: an erasure, seemingly, of the years of machinations and skulduggery and realpolitik that had come before.

Didn’t both Blair and Rice stand atop governments that denied Modi the ability to enter their respective countries for years, following the Gujarat massacres? Didn’t Kissinger – at whom Modi is snapped gazing fondly – once say some less than complimentary things about India when he worked for Richard Nixon?

But enough of all...
description: All glory is fleeting, the saying goes, though perhaps not more so than power.
